Pros:
• Comfortable size: Many users found the pens to be comfortable to hold and use.
    
• Smooth lines: The pens produce smooth lines with no skips or blobs.
    
• Ink dries quickly: The ink dries quickly, preventing smudging and smearing.
    
• Great for journaling: The pens are perfect for journaling, note-taking, and other creative projects.
    
• Not smudge resistant: The ink is not smudge resistant, so it is important to wait for the ink to dry before highlighting or erasing.
Cons:
• Skips and fades as you write: Some users reported that the pens skip and fade as they write, making it difficult to write cursive.

• Not real Muji pens: Some users reported that the pens are not real Muji pens and are instead counterfeits.

• Ink flow is not good: Some users reported that the ink flow is not good and that the pens smudge when highlighting.

• Uncomfortable to write with: Some users reported that the pens are uncomfortable to write with due to the sharp edges.

Performance:
• Positive feedback on writing experience: Many consumers praised the smooth writing experience of these pens, with some describing them as the "best pens they've ever used." Others noted that the ink dries quickly and does not smudge, making them ideal for lefties.
